column3: Back

The thing is, I don’t have enough money right now.
The thing is, nobody told me about the change.
The thing is, I’m really bad at directions.
The thing is, we’re already late.
The thing is, my phone died.

What happened was, I missed the bus and arrived late.
What happened was, the shop was closed when I got there.
What happened was, someone took my seat on the train.
What happened was, I forgot my lines on stage.
What happened was, the cake fell on the floor.

The other day I ran into my old teacher.
The other day I found twenty pounds on the street.
The other day my boss shouted at me.
The other day I tried sushi for the first time.
The other day I got completely lost in London.

A while back I lived in Spain for a year.
A while back I broke my leg skiing.
A while back I worked in a restaurant.
A while back I dyed my hair blue.
A while back I quit smoking.

I remember when phones had wires.
I remember when Netflix sent DVDs in the post.
I remember when I failed my driving test three times.
I remember when we stayed up all night talking.
I remember when I first met you.

It all started when I clicked that wrong link.
It all started when I missed my flight.
It all started when she smiled at me.
It all started when I bought that lottery ticket.
It all started when the alarm didn’t go off.

Out of the blue, my ex texted me.
Out of the blue, it started snowing.
Out of the blue, I got offered the job.
Out of the blue, the car broke down.
Out of the blue, she said yes.

All of a sudden, the lights went out.
All of a sudden, everyone started clapping.
All of a sudden, I felt really dizzy.
All of a sudden, it started pouring with rain.
All of a sudden, my phone rang.

Before I knew it, the whole day was gone.
Before I knew it, I’d eaten the entire cake.
Before I knew it, I was crying.
Before I knew it, we were lost.
Before I knew it, it was midnight.

The next thing I knew, I was in hospital.
The next thing I knew, everyone was laughing at me.
The next thing I knew, the police were there.
The next thing I knew, I’d won.
The next thing I knew, he was gone.

As it turned out, he was right all along.
As it turned out, the meeting was cancelled.
As it turned out, she already knew.
As it turned out, it was much cheaper online.
As it turned out, nobody came.

In the end, we decided to stay home.
In the end, everything worked out fine.
In the end, I got the job.
In the end, we missed the train.
In the end, she said yes.

column1: To cut a long story short…
column3:
To cut a long story short, I got fired.
To cut a long story short, we got married.
To cut a long story short, I passed.
To cut a long story short, the car broke down.
To cut a long story short, he apologised.

Long story short, we missed the flight.
Long story short, I quit.
Long story short, they broke up.
Long story short, I won £100.
Long story short, nobody showed up.

Anyway, I was saying I’m moving next month.
Anyway, where were we?
Anyway, let’s go back to the plan.
Anyway, I ended up buying the red one.
Anyway, enough about me – how are you?

So basically, the project failed.
So basically, we’re broke.
So basically, I’m single again.
So basically, I’m moving to Canada.
So basically, nobody listened.

That reminds me, I need to call my mum.
That reminds me, did you return the book?
That reminds me, I owe you twenty pounds.
That reminds me, we’re out of milk.
That reminds me, happy birthday!

Speaking of which, have you seen John lately?
Speaking of which, I brought cake.
Speaking of which, how’s your new job?
Speaking of which, it’s your turn to pay.
Speaking of which, where’s my phone?

column1: Back to what I was saying…
column3:
Back to what I was saying, we need a new plan.
Back to what I was saying, the food was awful.
Back to what I was saying, she never replied.
Back to what I was saying, I quit.
Back to what I was saying, let’s go.

Where was I? Oh yes, the day of the interview…
Where was I? Right, the car broke down…
Where was I? Yeah, then he started crying…
Where was I? Ah, the part about the money…
Where was I? Anyway, we got there late…

I’ll never forget the time we got stuck in the lift.
I’ll never forget the time I met Beyoncé.
I’ll never forget the time I failed my exam.
I’ll never forget the time we missed the last train.
I’ll never forget the time he proposed.

There was this one time I accidentally dyed my hair green.
There was this one time I called my teacher “Mum”.
There was this one time I got locked out naked.
There was this one time I won £500.
There was this one time I fell off the stage.

You won’t believe this, but I saw your ex yesterday.
You won’t believe this, but I quit my job.
You won’t believe this, but I’m moving to Japan.
You won’t believe this, but I’m getting married.
You won’t believe this, but I passed!
